definition: the spirit or character of a political party
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The principle of Party property is the fundamental principle of jural news.
sentences.chinese: 党性原则是法制新闻的基本原则。

sentences.english: Leading officials' style of work is essentially the question of Party spirit.
sentences.chinese: 领导干部作风问题，说到底是党性问题。

sentences.english: In order to achieve stability and unity, we must eliminate factionalism and enhance Party spirit.
sentences.chinese: 要安定团结，就必须消除派性，增强党性。

sentences.english: Strengthening mastery of party spirit is a good tradition of reinforcing self-construction of our party.
sentences.chinese: 加强党性修养是我们党强化自身建设的优良传统。

sentences.english: The essence of Lenin's "indoctrination theory" is the formation of the "indoctrination" party spirit view.
sentences.chinese: 列宁“灌输”理论的精髓在于形成了“灌输”党性观。

definition: to fight corruption and forestall moral degeneration
the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses
Serve the People!, CCP political slogan
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
